title: expected bsc synchronisation time?
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2022.08.1-alpha-7dabdc32`

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash : 

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon on BSC should synchronise within a month.

#### Actual behaviour
I have been running an Erigon (with rpcdaemon) instance on BSC chain. I tried different hardware.
Currently it is on NVMe storage, powerful processor and 100+ GB RAM.

It did not respond for some time, then it started to respond but it reported the same height for 3 weeks.
Then it started to report a growing blockheight. Then it stopped again and the blockheight is static.

I don't know what's going on. What is the expected behaviour? How long is it supposed to take to synchronise it?

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
```
make erigon
...
erigon --datadir /data/erigon --chain bsc --private.api.addr=localhost:9090
```

#### Backtrace

After a more than a month the logs still say:
```
[INFO] [08-09|09:34:38.487] Req/resp stats                           req=0 reqMin=0 reqMax=0 skel=0 skelMin=0 skelMax=0 resp=0 respMin=0 respMax=0 dups=0
[INFO] [08-09|09:34:38.487] Queue sizes                              anchors=0 links=0 persisted=65536
[INFO] [08-09|09:34:58.487] [1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=20286646 blk/second=0.000 alloc=2.1GB sys=2.7GB
[INFO] [08-09|09:34:58.488] Req/resp stats                           req=0 reqMin=0 reqMax=0 skel=0 skelMin=0 skelMax=0 resp=0 respMin=0 respMax=0 dups=0
[INFO] [08-09|09:34:58.488] Queue sizes                              anchors=0 links=0 persisted=65536
[INFO] [08-09|09:35:18.472] [txpool] stat                            block=0 pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=0 alloc=2.1GB sys=2.7GB
[INFO] [08-09|09:35:18.488] [1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=20286646 blk/second=0.000 alloc=2.1GB sys=2.7GB
[INFO] [08-09|09:35:18.488] Req/resp stats                           req=0 reqMin=0 reqMax=0 skel=0 skelMin=0 skelMax=0 resp=0 respMin=0 respMax=0 dups=0
[INFO] [08-09|09:35:18.488] Queue sizes                              anchors=0 links=0 persisted=65536
[INFO] [08-09|09:35:38.487] [1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=20286646 blk/second=0.000 alloc=2.1GB sys=2.7GB
[INFO] [08-09|09:35:38.488] Req/resp stats                           req=0 reqMin=0 reqMax=0 skel=0 skelMin=0 skelMax=0 resp=0 respMin=0 respMax=0 dups=0
[INFO] [08-09|09:35:38.488] Queue sizes                              anchors=0 links=0 persisted=65536
[WARN] [08-09|09:35:52.051] Added future link                        hash=0xe743fe1a5aa751e66adb826f83b3b23cecfb7b87171e05de507447d292db1b05 height=20286728 timestamp=1660037753
[WARN] [08-09|09:35:53.051] Added future link                        hash=0xe84496ed5151c57de7a19ee082252abd77df24bda865977917003376a23b9287 height=20286729 timestamp=1660037756
[WARN] [08-09|09:35:53.280] Added future link                        hash=0xe84496ed5151c57de7a19ee082252abd77df24bda865977917003376a23b9287 height=20286729 timestamp=1660037756
[WARN] [08-09|09:35:54.019] Added future link                        hash=0xe84496ed5151c57de7a19ee082252abd77df24bda865977917003376a23b9287 height=20286729 timestamp=1660037756
[WARN] [08-09|09:35:55.020] Added future link                        hash=0xe84496ed5151c57de7a19ee082252abd77df24bda865977917003376a23b9287 height=20286729 timestamp=1660037756
[WARN] [08-09|09:35:55.248] Added future link                        hash=0xe84496ed5151c57de7a19ee082252abd77df24bda865977917003376a23b9287 height=20286729 timestamp=1660037756
```

This "added future link" has been going on for a few weeks.

something wrong with node. Logs show only `[1/16 Headers]`, but they must show other stages also. seems something get stuck. Please show us more logs. Then try "grep WARN" "grep EROR" "grep ERR" logs. Maybe you had some error in the past - and this is the reason of stuck. If nothing like this, then try update Erigon - maybe your node has no Euler hard-fork support: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/4461 and https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/4500
If nothing helps: try 
```
make integration 
./build/bin/integration stage_headers --unwind=100 --datadir=<your_datadir> --chain=bsc
```
If this also doesn't help: show us new logs.

Hi @AskAlexSharov, thank you very much for the hints. I didn't find anything useful in the logs. I had tried to run Erigon on different machines, then copied the data from one to the other and started again. So I don't have the old logs anymore.
I am already on the latest release. But I started to synchronise it long-long time ago, don't know which version it was back then. 

So if I didn't have the Euler support earlier, does it mean I have to resync?

I also tried the integration, first with 100, then 1000 and 50000 - to no avail.

The logs look like this now:
```
[INFO] [08-10|07:28:22.394] Build info                               git_branch=HEAD git_tag=v2022.08.01 git_commit=7dabdc3269f1e3b098fee5ab4d96ec843823a6fd

" does it mean I have to resync?" - no. as i told you can try:
```
make integration 
./build/bin/integration state_stages --unwind=100 --datadir=<your_datadir> --chain=bsc
./build/bin/integration stage_headers --unwind=100 --datadir=<your_datadir> --chain=bsc
```
do you use external RPCDaemon? If yes, does it have --datadir option?

Hi @AskAlexSharov , I tried these integration commands but they did not solve the problem.
I dropped the whole data and started to synchronise from scratch. After 4 days it only downloaded 516 GB and the logs still look pretty much the same:

Now I have 520 GB data.

Hi @AskAlexSharov,
i tried to debug it as much as possible.

erigon version 2022.08.2-alpha-35c4faa1
Tried to compile with 1.18 and 1.19, same error.

Machine is  AMD Ryzen 9 5950X, 128GB ram + 512GB swap.

erigon --chain bsc --datadir /data/erigon/erigon --private.api.addr 0.0.0.0:9090 --http.port 8545 --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.vhosts "*" --http.api eth,engine,erigon,trace --verbosity 4 --downloader.verify

We start sync from the scratch, and after ~400GB of snapshots downloaded:
`DBUG[08-22|08:27:28.810] too many anchors: 512, limit 512`

If i stop erigon process and start it again then db is corrupted:

```
INFO[08-20|08:40:44.037] new subscription to newHeaders established 
EROR[08-20|08:40:44.037] catch panic                              err="runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference" stack="[main.go:29 panic.go:884 panic.go:260 signal_unix.go:835 index.go:149 block_snapshots.go:179 config.go:245 block_snapshots.go:286 config.go:243 backend.go:572 node.go:115 main.go:58 app.go:526 app.go:286 main.go:34 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1594]"
```

--unwind=100 (1000) for state_stages and stage_headers does not help
--downloader.verify - also.

Interesting that i see swap usage around 200MB when downloading snapshots. Kernel vm.swappiness set to 0.
Maybe memleak somewhere?

Please advice how to debug it properly, currently this is "game stopper" problem for us.

... and erigon_2022.99.99-dev-ede0d437 continued the snapshot sync normally.
Will see what happens next.

```

I will check today
